result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis A Villanueva Romero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 1 and Ct 2

miscConds.notes:
Fees, surcharges and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Bond of $650.00 applied
CORRECTED 5-19-2015 CHARGING DEFENDANT FOR $400.00(2COUNTS)NOT $600.00 FOR DNA SURCHARGE-BOND RE-APPLIED TO  REMAINING COSTS
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

The defendant shall have no contact with Yenix Flores Najera of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  EXCEPTION for work but must maintain absolute sobriety
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant was granted 38 days credit for time served.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Luis A Villanueva Romero, appeared with Attorney Bonnie Wachsmuth.  Susan Rascon and Enrique Soria sworn as interpreter. Per the State Amended information will be filed dismissing the sexual assualt, victim makes that request in Court. Defendant waives reading of remaining charges and enters a plea of not guilty. Defense requests reduction of the bond to a signature bond. State requests a cash bond. Bond amended to $650.00 cash with same conditions
